exercises.question: Conjugate (être) in present tense, first person singular (I am)
exercises.explanation: 'Je suis' means 'I am'. Être (to be) is one of the most important irregular verbs in French.

exercises.question: Conjugate (avoir) in present tense, first person singular (I have)
exercises.explanation: 'J'ai' means 'I have'. Avoir (to have) is another essential irregular verb.

exercises.question: Conjugate (parler) in present tense, first person singular (I speak)
exercises.explanation: 'Je parle' means 'I speak'. Regular -er verbs follow this pattern.

exercises.question: Conjugate (manger) in present tense, first person singular (I eat)
exercises.explanation: 'Je mange' means 'I eat'. Manger is a regular -er verb.

exercises.question: Conjugate (aller) in present tense, first person singular (I go)
exercises.explanation: 'Je vais' means 'I go'. Aller (to go) is an irregular verb.

exercises.question: Conjugate (faire) in present tense, first person singular (I do/make)
exercises.explanation: 'Je fais' means 'I do' or 'I make'. Faire is an irregular verb.

exercises.question: Conjugate (vouloir) in present tense, first person singular (I want)
exercises.explanation: 'Je veux' means 'I want'. Vouloir is an irregular verb.

exercises.question: Conjugate (pouvoir) in present tense, first person singular (I can)
exercises.explanation: 'Je peux' means 'I can'. Pouvoir is an irregular verb.

exercises.question: Conjugate (aimer) in present tense, first person singular (I like/love)
exercises.explanation: 'J'aime' means 'I like' or 'I love'. Regular -er verb.
